intro: Horkelia fusca var. tenella, commonly known as the slender horkelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It has narrow, linear leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. Horkelia fusca var. tenella thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and arid environments.
